level.text: No expense, including compensation, shall be incurred or amounts paid in connection with a bingo operation by a licensed organization, except those reasonably expended and directly related to the operation.
A licensed organization may reimburse each worker no more than fifteen dollars ($15) for expenses per occasion.

No expense, including compensation, shall be incurred or amounts paid based on a percentage of gross receipts, or net proceeds from a bingo operation, except payments based upon a percentage of gross receipts to provide a combined prize fund for, or to compensate for services rendered in connection with, a multihall bingo game.

Money for reasonable and necessary expenses ordinarily incidental to bingo operations shall be paid from the gross receipts only by checks having consecutive numbers drawn on the bingo bank account according to ยง 1411.
Each check drawn on the bingo account shall be made payable to the specific payee providing the goods or rendering the service which gives rise to the expense.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 35 DCR 3788, 3810 (May 20, 1988); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 38 DCR 2048, 2052 (April 5, 1991).

level.heading: HISTORICAL NOTE
level.text: Prior to May 20, 1988, the D.C. Lottery and Charitable Games Control Board published Final Rulemaking at 29 DCR 5016, 5028 (November 12, 1982).
